summary: This document contains the Articles of Incorporation and subsequent annual franchise tax reports for Maple, Inc., a US Virgin Islands corporation formed in 2011. The corporation lists Jeffrey E. Epstein as President/Director, with Richard Kahn and Darren Indyke as other officers. The filings show the corporation's purpose as 'Holding Property for Personal Use' and its financial statements from 2011 to 2017.

persons.name: Gregory R. Francis
persons.role: Lieutenant Governor of the Virgin Islands
persons.context: Certifies the filing of the Articles of Incorporation for Maple, Inc. on December 27, 2011.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals
persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation and part of the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP, which served as the initial resident agent.

persons.name: Gregory J. Ferguson
persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation and part of the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP.

persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation; also appears later as a notary public acknowledging a signature.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as President and Director of Maple, Inc. in all annual reports from 2012 to 2018, with a St. Thomas, USVI address.

persons.name: Richard Kahn

persons.name: Darren Indyke

events.title: Incorporation of Maple, Inc.
events.description: Maple, Inc. is incorporated in the US Virgin Islands by Erika A. Kellerhals, Gregory J. Ferguson, and Brett Geary. The Articles of Incorporation are filed.

events.title: Certification of Incorporation
events.description: Lieutenant Governor Gregory R. Francis certifies the filing of the Articles of Incorporation for Maple, Inc.

events.title: Change of Resident Agent
events.description: Maple, Inc. changes its resident agent from Kellerhals Ferguson LLP to Business Basics VI, LLC. The change is documented in a Certificate of Change of Resident Agent signed by Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke.

keyFacts: Maple, Inc. was incorporated in the US Virgin Islands on November 22, 2011, with the stated purpose of 'Holding Property for Personal Use.'
Jeffrey E. Epstein is listed as the President and Director of Maple, Inc. in all annual reports from 2012 through 2018.
The corporation's other officers were Richard Kahn (Treasurer/Director) and Darren Indyke (Vice President/Secretary/Director).
Financial statements show the company had minimal activity, with a paid-in capital of $1,000 and consistent net losses from 2013 to 2017, resulting in an accumulated deficit.
The corporation changed its resident agent from the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP to Business Basics VI, LLC in September 2012.
